channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report X-2023070247
item.description:
Report X-2023070247

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-28T15:11:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-28
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: spilldevgrp@fedex.com
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 28th, a package was found on the belt during the sort that was leaking. The package had zero indications of containing and hazardous materials inside other than the name of the product Gravista Insecticide. Upon investigating the package an employee did come into contact with the chemical. The package was opened and two inner receptacles, each containing approximately 9.5 L were inside with one having leaked. It is unknown what caused the leak. After reviewing the SDS this is a UN3082 Environmentally Hazardous Substance, liquid, 9, PGIII shipment since the inner receptacles are more than 5L. The spill was cleaned up and the package was placed into a salvage drum and held at the station pending disposition

item.title: Report E-2023070207
item.description:
Report E-2023070207

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-28T15:11:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-29
  • City: GARLAND
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LGT experienced a UN3262 DS-88 Alkaline Cleaner release from a 5-gallon poly pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-pound of product released to a 2' x 2' area of the trailer floor due to improper loading/load shift. The damaged pail and released product were collected along with all cleanup debris into a 30-gallon and 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023070203
item.description:
Report E-2023070203

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-28T15:11:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-08
  • City: MIDLAND
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 8, 2023, at 0000 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Midland, Texas regarding the release of approximately (1) gallon of CRW 9220 Corrosion Inhibitor (Flammable liquid, toxic, n.o.s., (Methanol, Isopropanol), UN1992, 3, 6.1, III) from (7) 55-gallon poly drums. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release was contained to the tops of the drums only, contractors wiped down the totes and tightened the drum caps so the cargo could be forwarded on to the original consignee. All waste generated was containerized in (1) 55-gallon poly drum which was then taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023070189
item.description:
Report E-2023070189

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-28T15:11:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 21, 2023, one (1) 330-gallon tote of NA1993 was damaged by a load shift and released approximately one-fourth (1/4) of a gallon to the trailer interior and pavement underneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Allied International Emergency Services (AIES) to remediate the impacted surfaces. Crews observed there was no product spilled and no spill to clean up. AIES personnel were unable to obtain a 330-gallon tote for a transfer. They will arrive onsite to complete the transfer the following day and this was approved by Ronald Stevenson. Crews secured the scene and demobilized. On June 22, 2023, AIES personnel arrived and assessed the site. Crews utilized a new 330-gallon tote to initiate, and complete a transfer from the damaged 330-gallon drum. One (1) 330-gallon damaged tote was staged onsite after transfer for terminal disposal.

X-2023070168 SequenceEvent: Packages were found in bags off truck. Once given to QA, the hazmats were taken in red totes to the Hazmat cage. DescribePack: Inadequate seals of lids DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmats were placed into bags upon noticing release.

item.title: Report X-2023070141
item.description:
Report X-2023070141

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-28T15:11:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-29
  • City: VICTORIA
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA for inspection, package was moved to hazmat cage to be further inspected. Upon inspection it was found that the side of the Hazmat was wet from the interior, opening the package led to the discovery that one of the gallons of sodium hydroxide solution was leaking. Cap was initially loose, proceeded to remove the cap and found that the closure seal had failed and was opened. This paired with the loose cap led to a leakage every time the package was moved. DescribePack: Plastic closure seal had burst open halfway. 1/2 an inch of the seal had been opened. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a hazardous materials bin and was transported to designated hazmat cage.

item.description:
Report E-2023070041

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-29
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a UN3266 Triple-D Universal Coil Cleaner release from a box containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 2' x 2' area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. The damaged pail and impacted cardboard and debris were neutralized with sodium bicarb and containerized into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023070022
item.description:
Report E-2023070022

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Allied International Emergency was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 10ft- by-10ft area of the terminal floor and estimated that twenty (20) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging eighteen (18) 1-gallon plastic jugs. Allied International Emergency personnel separated the non-damaged plastic jugs and placed them on the side to be shipped onto the consignee. Allied International Emergency personnel neutralized the impacted area and deployed granular absorbents to collect the released material. Allied International Emergency personnel gathered all spent material and debris placed into three (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The impacted pallet was cut-up and placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The empty plastic jugs were placed into an additional 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found by PM QA at end of their shift. Hazmat was not declared and was wet at bottom. No markings or labels on package. Was only identified as a Hazmat when QA looked up product for damage report. Left isolated from others until full investigation on what to do next. DescribePack: 1 bottle ruptured inside and cracked; cause from extreme heat and poor packaging of reusing old box. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Package was isolated from VSA and the belt.

item.title: Report E-2023060800
item.description:
Report E-2023060800

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-01
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LHO experienced a UN3082 CRODATERIC CAS 50-LQ-(MH) release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons of product released to a 6' x 6' area of the dock floor and a 20' x 24' area of the concrete lot below. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The material was transferred into a new tote. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into (3) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was removed from site pending disposal.
